template byaddr1(lhs, typ, ex)
  Source   Edit 
template deduplicateIt[T](inseq: seq[T]; op: untyped; isSorted: bool = false): seq[
    T]
Deduplicate values in sequence. If not isSorted and value of op cannot be compared (no operator < is defined) naive O(n^2) deduplication is used. Otherwise items are sorted and deduplicated in O(nlogn)   Source   Edit 
template eachIt(main, expr: untyped)
  Source   Edit 
template findIt(s: typed; op: untyped): int
Find first element of the sequence for which op evaluates as true and return it's index. If no such element is found return -1   Source   Edit

  Source   Edit 
template isMutable(v: typed): untyped
  Source   Edit 
template mergeUniqByIt(sequence, operation: untyped): untyped
For each element in sequence apply operation and compare results. Consequent items from sequence with equal results will be added into single subsequence   Source   Edit 
template sortIt[T](sequence: var seq[T]; expr: untyped): untyped
  Source   Edit 
template subnodesEq(lhs, rhs, field: untyped): untyped
Check if two objects lhs and rhs has identical field field by comparing all items in the field. Check if two object's fields have identical lengths too.   Source   Edit 
template sweepGroupByIt(sequence, op: untyped): untyped
  Source   Edit 
template twoPassSortByIt(sequence, operation1, operation2: untyped): untyped
Sort input sequence using firt operation1, then group into 2d-sequence based on result of operation1 and sort each subsequence using operation2   Source   Edit
